channel.title: Join Hemp in the battle to save planet
channel.description: Join Hemp in the battle to save planet

item.title: Hemp Farming Legislation, Hemp Information and Advocacy - Vote Hemp
item.description:
Hemp Farming Legislation, Hemp Information and Advocacy - Vote Hemp

Vote Hemp is a national, single-issue, nonprofit organization dedicated to the acceptance of and free market for low-THC industrial hemp and to changes in current law to allow U.S. farmers to once again grow hemp as a commercial crop.

item.title: Hempcrete Natural Building
item.description:
Hempcrete Natural Building

It's friendly to our environment, cost effective, energy saving, and easy to work with. To learn more about all of the benefits of hempcrete over traditional building materials explore our site, sign up for a workshop, or contact us for more information.

item.title: Why HEMP can save humankind: Research scientist speaks out...
item.description:
Why HEMP can save humankind: Research scientist speaks out...

I'm a food scientist running LC/MS instrumentation to examine organic compounds and contaminants in foods and plants. * What I'm seeing in HEMP is mind-blowing. The complexity and intricacy of the plant is extraordinary. * The molecular constituents of hemp are FINE-TUNED molecules for spontaneous human healing. This cannot be a coincidence...

item.title: HempCrete Strongest & Greenest Building material in Nature
item.description:
HempCrete Strongest & Greenest Building material in Nature

MORE HEMP VIDEO BELOW - Song : The Luminaries - Hemp Can Save the World Hemp has always been a cash crop. Fuel may be the most important product you can get from hemp for our growing energy needs, but there are literally thousands of different products you can make from hemp.

item.title: Industrial Hemp: A Win-Win For The Economy And The Environment
item.description:
Industrial Hemp: A Win-Win For The Economy And The Environment

Logan Yonavjak (@Loganyon) makes a case for allowing farmers in the United States to grow hemp. Industrial hemp was once a dominant crop on the American landscape. This hardy and renewable resource (one of the earliest domesticated plants known, with roots dating back to the Neolothic Age in China) was refined [...]

item.title: This Kid Is Passionate About The Environment | Emotional Environmentalist
item.description:
This Kid Is Passionate About The Environment | Emotional Environmentalist

This little man's passion for environmental issues is inspiring! Emotional environmentalist little boy crying about people "Wrecking" the planet will break your heart.

item.title: Why Kentucky farmers are quitting tobacco and turning to hemp
item.description:
Why Kentucky farmers are quitting tobacco and turning to hemp

A Farm Bill passed by Congress last year included an amendment granting states and universities the right to research hemp. Several states have since started research projects, but Kentucky is at the forefront, experimenting with creating a new industry around this plant. NewsHour's Christopher Booker reports.
